intro: Eriochilus helonomos, commonly known as the pink mountain grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the plantain family (Plantaginaceae) and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The species features slender, hairy stems and produces small, pinkish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in open heathlands and rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
